intro: Sida borussica, commonly known as the common sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Sida borussica is known for its ability to tolerate various environmental conditions, making it a common weed in many regions.
